works.description: Undoubtedly one of the most beautiful watches I’ve seen ever, the ‘”O” by Japanese designer Tokujin Yoshioka celebrates the 10th anniversary of the Issey Miyake watch project, in development with Seiko instruments. The name “O” comes from the fact that the French word for water is eau and it’s pronounced as “o.” The elegant timepiece, based on the concept Shape of Water – Transparent Time, has been designed to look like an inviting ice block sculpted out of water. The upshot is an amazing bangle watch that reflects its surroundings.
